item.title: Roman Senninger
item.description: I am an Associate Professor of Political Science at Aarhus University. My research focuses on political elites and political institutions in Europe. I seek to understand how politicians select and use information for decision-making. Methodologically, I have a strong interest in (quasi-) experiments and computational social science. Currently, I’m holding a three-year Semper Ardens Accelerate Grant from the Carlsberg Foundation for the project ‘POLABROAD - How and Why Politicians Learn From Policies from Abroad’.
